titleStmt.title: An electronic transcription of the Cairo Genizah Fragment TS NS 329.286

publicationStmt.pubPlace: The Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities

availability.p: This work is copyright Hayim Lapin and the Joseph and Rebecca Meyerhoff Center for Jewish Studies and licensed under a .

note.p: Published as a sample text for a digital edition of the Mishnah, using oXygen
Fragment in the Cambridge University Libraries, Taylor-Schechter Collection (New Series). Covers Bava Qamma 10:8 - 10; Bava Metsi'a 1:1 - 2:10
Transcription from online images of the manuscript, available at the Friedenberg Genizah Project, https://fgp.genizah.org, FGP nos. C102610-C102611
Supplied text based on Kaufmann ms, Library of the Hungarian Academy of Sciences, Kaufmann A50, except when preserved remains make such restoration unlikely.

ab.w: הב For lines 8 through 11 location of line break is approximate.
כולה Expect חציה. Mark over ל to note erasure?
והחזיק Only slight traces are visible. Here and in the lines that follow there is considerable damage on the written surface, and the division between missing text and traces is approximate.

מפריחין
Traces consistent with -חין are visible at the end of the badly damaged text.

w.note: Some traces visible on the left of the lacuna.

ab.w: שניTraces seem to be consistent with שני rather than שאני. או מר

ז
Supplied text is a bit long for the available space.יר

w.note: Abbreviation mark visible over letter traces.
Especially given the space before the beginning of the halakhah, the supplied text is too long for the gap.

ab.w: Possible traces of a character giving the number of the halakhah. However, such labels are absent throughout the fragment.מצא

w.note: First two to three characters covered by folded parchment. Text in Kaufmann is shorter than available space. (Partially accounted for if scribe did not abbreviate.)

ab.w: Text in Kaufmann is surprisingly shorter than available space. Possibly, the scribe began a new halakhah (preceded by several character-lengths of empty space) at כל דבר as in Kaufmann. ע

w.note: There is more space available than accounted for by supplied text. Assuming no abbreviations would expand the supplied text by four characters.
Space considerations suggest a restored text with out בטל.
